location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 39 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is requesting the sanction of the Bombay Government for a present given by Captain Henry Hardy, Senior Officer commanding the squadron in the Persian Gulf, to the Shaikh of Moghoo. It further relays a request that the Captain should be provided with a supply of gifts, so that he may reward 'native chiefs' as he deems fit.
